intro: Polyalthia polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited evergreen, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by oval, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
